dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3607 IH: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish fees for medical services provided in units of the National Park System, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. McClintock (for himself and Mr. Tipton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish fees for medical services provided in units of the National Park System, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: The Secretary may establish and collect fees for medical services provided to persons in units of the National Park System.
There is hereby established in the Treasury a fund to be known as the National Park Medical Services Fund. The Fund shall consist ofâ€”
All amounts deposited into the Fund shall be available to the Secretary, to the extent provided in advance by Acts of appropriation, for the following in units of the National Park System:

paragraph.text: Preparing needs assessments or other programmatic analyses for medical facilities, equipment, vehicles, and other needs and costs of providing services listed in subsection (a).
Developing management plans for medical facilities, equipment, vehicles, and other needs and costs of services listed in subsection (a).
Training related to providing services listed in subsection (a).
Obtaining or improving medical facilities, equipment, vehicles, and other needs and costs of providing services listed in subsection (a).

subsection.text: For the purposes of this section:

paragraph.text: The term Fund means the National Park Medical Services Fund established by subsection (b).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.
